10.text: When double-jumping, time your 2nd jump carefully to get the greatest distance.

106.text: Having trouble finding your way? Binoculars may show you a clue. Have a look!

107.text: The Maelstrom is trying to attack Nexus Tower! Speak to Duke Exeter in the Sentinel Command Center to join the battle!

11.text: If you get stuck, you can smash yourself by clicking the ? icon, and then the life preserver icon.

112.text: The Nexus Force has created powerful two-handed weapons! See your Faction Vendor in Nexus Tower!

12.text: Help can be found by clicking the ? icon.

122.text: New Faction Kits are here! Check Nimbus Station and Nexus Tower to find out what the Factions have created!

124.text: Nexus Tower: Home of the Nexus Force. Safeguard of the Imagination Nexus. And the center of LEGO Universe!

125.text: Now you can increase your Minifigure's Level to 45! Complete Missions and Achievements to earn U-Score!

126.text: Have you deleted a mission or achievement reward? Visit Honor Accolade in Nexus Tower to buy them back!

127.text: Buy these Model Sets from Kirsten Quasar or Eekums the Monkey at the Avant Gardens Launch Area!

128.text: An all-new Ninjago world has appeared in LEGO Universe! Fly there from the launcher at Nexus Tower!

129.storyTitle: Have Your Cape and Wear It Too!
129.text: Every Minifigure looks more heroic with a cape! Reach Level 30 to buy Capes, and reach Level 40 to get the Valiant Capes!

13.text: You can collect models and bricks to build amazing creations on your Property.

130.text: Fight this Maelstrom monster when you claim your Block Yard Property! Then explore the new Spider Caves to fight her again!

131.text: Find the new Ninjago Monastery and Skeleton Outpost Sets on Ninjago!

133.text: Protect the Weapons of Spinjitzu from the Skeletons and unleash the powers of Earth, Lightning, Ice and Fire!

134.storyTitle: Are you a Nexus Force Champion?
134.text: Calling all Builders, Battlers and Racers! Get ready for the Nexus Force Championships!

14.text: Find the hidden Story Plaques spread throughout each world.

15.text: Check your Passport for information on Missions and Achievements - and the rewards you'll receive from completing them!

16.text: Each world in LEGO Universe has hidden collectibles. Find them all for rewards like extra Life Points.

18.text: Did you know you can join a Faction in Nimbus Station?

19.text: Challenge your friends at the Vertigo Loop racetrack in Nimbus Station.

20.text: Double-Jump by tapping the spacebar twice.

21.text: Hold the right mouse button down to move your camera around and view things from a different angle.

22.text: You can unlock more Backpack space in Nimbus Station.

23.text: More words are constantly being added to the Chat System's whitelist.

24.text: Joining a Faction unlocks the ability to wear Specialty Kit gear.

26.text: The Venture League Faction offers Specialties such as the Buccaneer and the Daredevil.

28.text: The Sentinel Faction offers Specialties such as the Knight and the Samurai.

29.text: The Paradox Faction offers Specialties such as the Sorcerer and the Space Marauder.

30.text: The Assembly Faction offers Specialties such as the Engineer and the Summoner.

31.text: Collect Faction Tokens to purchase Specialty Kit gear and unlock higher ranks in your Specialties.

32.text: Join the Nexus Force and help them defend the Universe from the evil Maelstrom! Find the Nexus Force Recruiter in Nimbus Station.

36.text: Unlock Ranks 2 and 3 of your Specialty Kits by collecting all of the pieces of gear from the previous Rank.

37.text: Interact with the Tiki Torches in Gnarled Forest - they spit out Imagination power-ups!

38.text: Unlock extra Imagination Points by finding the Imagination Bricks hidden throughout the Universe!

39.text: Unlock extra Life Points by collecting sets of Flags hidden throughout the Universe!

40.text: As a Daredevil, you will be able to pull off extreme stunts as you defeat the Maelstrom. Join the Venture League to become a Daredevil!

42.text: As an Engineer, you will build clever devices to defeat your enemies and assist your allies. Join Assembly to become an Engineer!

43.text: As a Knight, your superior armor and battle skills will help you defeat your enemies in close combat. Join the Sentinel Faction to become a Knight!

44.text: As a Samurai, your strength and skill with sword and bow will allow you to vanquish the forces of the Maelstrom. Join the Sentinel Faction to become a Samurai!

45.text: As a Sorcerer, you will bend the forces of the Maelstrom to your will through massive blasts of energy. Join Paradox to become a Sorcerer!

46.text: As a Space Marauder, you will use powerful Maelstrom-based weaponry to defeat your opponents. Join Paradox to become a Space Marauder!

47.text: As a Summoner, you will conjure strange and loyal creatures to attack and defeat your foes. Join Assembly to become a Summoner!

48.text: As a Buccaneer, you will use swashbuckling moves and derring-do to smash your foes. Join the Venture League to become a Buccaneer!

5.text: When double-jumping, time your second jump carefully to get the greatest distance.

53.text: Getting smashed by enemies too much? Buy better gear from your Faction Vendor!

54.text: Heading into Forbidden Valley? Rank 2 Faction gear is highly recommended!

55.text: Are you falling off of cliffs too often? Remember to use the right mouse button to move your camera.

56.text: Have you equipped some new gear? Check your Action Bar for new skills.

57.text: Are you crashing on those tight turns in racing? Try using SHIFT to drift your car.

58.text: Feeling overwhelmed by the Maelstrom? Check your Action Bar for skills that can help you in combat!

6.text: Some weapons have charge-up attacks. Hold down the Attack key to charge up!

60.text: Have you tried Speedchat? Click the Speedchat icon in the lower left of the screen.

61.text: Once you join a Faction, you can collect all Specialty Kits for that Faction, not just the one you start with.

63.text: Be sure to stock up on Supplies before you head into battle!

65.text: Need more room in your Backpack? Check your Passport for Missions and Achievements that give you more space.

66.text: How many different Rockets have you built? The sky is the limit!

68.text:
How many different Race Cars have you built? Customize your ride!
How many different Modular Race Cars have you built? Customize your ride!

69.text: Once you join a Faction, you can collect Faction Tokens by smashing and building.

7.text: When on a Mission, click the round icon at the top of the screen to review the current Mission task.

70.text: You can accept more than one Mission at a time. Click the arrows at the top of your screen to view your current Missions.

71.text: Have you checked your mail lately? Look for mailboxes throughout LEGO Universe.

72.text: Want to race against other players? The Vertigo Loop racetrack in Nimbus Station is a great place to start.

73.text: Find the Pirate Hook in Gnarled Forest to race at the Keelhaul Canyon racetrack! Don’t forget to build a car first!

75.text: How many Properties have you claimed?

76.text: Use the Property Console to name your Property, write a description, allow visitors, and view your Property’s Reputation.

77.text: You can trade unlinked items, coins and bricks with any other player. Just move close, hit the CTRL key, and choose 'Ask to Trade with Me' from the drop-down menu.

78.text: When you equip an item, it becomes Linked to your Minifigure, and cannot be traded. Items from Achievements and Missions are automatically Linked.

8.text: Check your Passport regularly to find new Achievements to tackle!

80.text: When your Minifigure is smashed, you lose some of your coins. You can usually get them back - but not if you fall in the water!

81.text: Linked items cannot be traded. Try selling them to a Vendor instead of throwing them away. Bricks, coins, and Supplies never become Linked.

82.text: To visit the LEGO Club, you must first join the LEGO Club at www.LEGO.com.

83.text: Best Friends are players you already know in real life. Invite people on your Friends List to be Best Friends. Your parents will confirm this on the LEGO Universe web site.

84.text: Best Friends can do extra things in the game! Best Friends can IM and Mail with Super Chat, which lets you say much more than regular chat.

85.text: Best Friends can play on each other’s Properties, even when the Mythrans haven’t approved everything. Your Best Friends can even watch you build!

87.text: Play each of the Red Blocks concert instruments for 30 seconds and you will unlock more Backpack space!

89.text: Smash 500 enemies to unlock more Backpack space!

9.text: You can last longer in the Survival mini-game if you play with friends!

90.text: Discover all 3 paths up the Monument to unlock more Backpack space!

91.text: Collect enough Bananas in Gnarled Forest and you will unlock more Backpack space!

92.text: Use all 9 binoculars in Avant Gardens to unlock more Backpack space!
